item.title: Beocord 5000 (4716/4715): Removing the Drive Mechanism
item.description: Note: This post documents an outdated method. There’s a simpler way to remove the drive that doesn’t involve lifting the Pre-Amplifier board or disconnecting the solenoid linkage. See my later post for the updated procedure. Following advice from ‘chartz’ and ‘sonavor’ on Beoworld.org (link to thread), I began replacing the belts in my Beocord 5000 (4716), which had become loose and stretched over time. The first step is removing the drive mechanism.

item.title: Beocord 5000 (4715/4716): Replacing the Belts
item.description: I obtained replacement belts for my Beocord 5000 from ‘Dillen’ on Beoworld.org, allowing me to resume my work on the unit. Replacing the belts is a straightforward process, but it demands patience because the drive mechanism requires significant disassembly. The service manual only explains how to access the top belts, not the bottom ones. However, a Beoworld.org thread provided valuable insights and cautions, including a story about a broken PCB #3 (“Electronic Switch”) resulting from improper belt installation.

item.title: Beocord 5000 (4716/4715): First Contact
item.description: After a couple of evenings with the Beomaster 6000, my curiosity led me to the non-working Beocord 5000 (4716). The design is quite impressive, especially the electronic VU meters that use seven incandescent light bulbs each. This cutting-edge technology from the past is incredible! The attention to detail is remarkable. Here are some pictures: Plexiglass cover removed: Notice the two red tabs above the level knobs, they display the recording level!
